result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcellus Omar Shelby

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Report received and filed.

Defendant Marcellus Omar Shelby not in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Marcellus Omar Shelby.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Calendar Call.  Defendant not present in Court, Court removes the previous stayed bench warrant.  Additionally, this case was incorrectly tabbed to this court.  Case reassigned to Br. 13, Reserve Branch.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Marcellus Omar Shelby not in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court for Marcellus Omar Shelby.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Pretrial Conference.  Defense counsel has been recently appointed on this case and does not have contact information for defendant.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.
Calendar call scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.W
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Marcellus Omar Shelby appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Marcellus Omar Shelby.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
